general_advisory: Farmers should follow the specific crop advisories mentioned for better agricultural outcomes. Use OUAT KALINGA products for enhanced results.

advisory: To control mango hoppers spray Imidacloprid 17.8% SL or Thiamethoxam 25% W.G or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. First spray at the time of panicle emergence and second spray two weeks after.
To control aphids and thrips in chilli during primary stage of pest infestation, spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM.
Farmers should apply 35 kg Urea per acre at 3 weeks after transplanting at active tillering stage for high yielding paddy varieties.
In Zinc-deficient soil, apply Zinc Sulphate (21%) at 10 kg/acre every three years.
During primary stage of whitefly infestation, spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM.
To manage this pest chemically, spray Thiamethoxam 25 % WG, Pyriproxyfen 10% EC, or Spiromesifen 22.9% SC.
If fruit borer infestation prevails, spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C, Flubendiamide 39.5% M/MS.C, or Indoxacarb 14.5% S.C.
